body.p: The Board decided to provide guidance on how to make materiality judgements in the form of a non‑mandatory Practice Statement because:

li.p: issuing mandatory requirements in a Standard could risk appearing prescriptive, which could undermine the emphasis on entities applying their judgement in the assessment of materiality; and

issuing guidance as a separate non‑mandatory document, rather than as non‑mandatory implementation guidance supporting a specific Standard, such as IASÂ 1, would help to emphasise that the concept of materiality is pervasive throughout IFRS Standards.
